hero.content:
Why a teacher chose to serve in a 'last-mile school'

Situated in the far-flung area with limited public transportation, this school has been identified by the DepEd, as one of the country’s last mile schools.

primary.lead: <abbr title="International Criminal Court">ICC</abbr>'s Help Rejected by President Bongbong Marcos
primary.title: Philippines’ Marcos Rejects Helping ICC Investigate Duterte's Drug War
primary.description: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. stood by his position against an international probe on former leader Rodrigo Duterte’s drug war, underlining his efforts to keep the ruling alliance intact.

secondary.title: Bongbong Marcos: Gov’t studying possible return to ICC
secondary.description: Updated on November 24, 2023 at 12:25 p.m. MANILA, Philippines — President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said on Friday that the government is considering resuming its membership to the International

secondary.title: ICC entering PH not a surrender of sovereignty - Lagman
secondary.description: Manila, Philippines: Albay First District Rep. Edcel Lagman said that the entry of the International Criminal Court into the country to investigate alleged crimes related to the previous administration's war on drugs would not constitute a 'surrender of sovereignty' but an exercise of it.

secondary.title: Will Congress let the ICC in? - Manila Standard
secondary.description: There’s going to be a monumental shift in official policy if the House of Representatives approves resolutions calling on government to allow the International Criminal Court to enter the country and investigate the Duterte administration’s bloody war on illegal drugs from 2016 to 2019.

carousel.title: 10 years after Haiyan, are mangroves protecting Philippine coastal areas?
carousel.description: Mangroves create a natural breakwater but Manila is focused on man-made interventions to protect against future storms.

carousel.title: Solar boat for Philippines developed in Orkney
carousel.description: Stromness-based Aquatera says the boat is the first of its kind to be powered by renewables.

carousel.title: Scarborough 1st appeared on maps of Philippine waters in 1750s
carousel.description: On the night of Sept. 12, 1748Â the British East India Co. ship ScarboroughÂ struck the now-famous reef of the same name while on its way from England to China.

carousel.title: 17 Filipino crew members taken hostage in Red Sea — DFA
carousel.description: At least 17 Filipino crew members aboard a cargo ship in the Red Sea were among those taken hostage&nbsp;by Yemen-based Houthi Rebels, a Department of Foreign Affairs (DFA) official confirmed Wednesday, Nov. 22.
